In previous emails, others discussed the potential issue about dependencies.
I'm not sure whether there is a solution for that.

Hi @szaboferee I have reproduced the environment and you are right. 
I could happen that if the quota is reached in the middle of a “transaction”, the all file dumps.

It is necessary to check if the file weight is zero before doing any delete operation. Moreover it will be necessary to implement some sort of “stopper” in the “append” function of the BucketWriter class in order to achieve the expected behavior. 

I will try to do the modifications asap. Thank you and sorry for the stupid mistake.
@ffernandez92  can you add a test with a minicluster? It would make the review much easier
Hi @szaboferee sure, I will add a test with minicluster. Now I am uploading a new version as I am having some trouble with test part in local.

Rewrote the SpoolDirectorySource and ReliableSpoolingFileEventReader part.
Only increment the counters in ReliableSpoolingFileEventReader when the problem is handled with logging an error message only. When an exception is thrown, then it will be handled in SpoolDirectorySource, it is much clearer this way. This was one of the first ones I did, and the concept was not ready, yet. Created some Mockito test cases for SpoolDirectorySource changes but I did not create for the ReliableSpoolingFileEventReader part, since it is so simple, and would be quite difficult to test.
I did all the other requested changes, too.
retest this please
LGTM

We can add these environment variables, but I do not think it is really necessary.

Regarding JAVA_OPTS: yes, it is common the pass parameters and system properties to java, but FLUME_JAVA_OPTS can be used for this and can be defined as an environment variable, FLUME_JAVA_OPTS is appended after JAVA_OPTS so it has higher precedence

Regarding classpath: the best practice for using third party libraries is through plugins (by default the plugins.d directory), so adjusting the classpath should be needed in quite rare/special cases only
LGTM. Does what is required. Tests seem fine.

@turcsanyip I'm a bit confused by this patch. I've definitely used the -D parameters for specifying the truststore locations and truststore passwords - certainly Kafka (but I also suspect HTTP and Avro) will eventually use the -D locations, as this is standard Java behaviour. I'm not really sure what this is adding. I'm also nervous about clearing the system properties for the law of unintended consequences.

@tmgstevens -D parameters does not work for _keystores_ in the current version. If SSL is enabled but the keystore is not defined in the agent config, then we get a config error and the source will not start (HTTPSource, AvroSource, ThriftSource).

Regarding _truststores_, you are right: -D parameters can work for them already in Flume 1.8.
However, it is not really well documented in the User Guide, eg. AvroSink's truststore parameter: _"If not specified, the default Java JSSE certificate authority files (typically “jssecacerts” or “cacerts” in the Oracle JRE) will be used."_
More precisely: the -D parameter will be used, and if it is not defined either, then jssecacerts/cacerts.

The system properties are cleared only in tests (to clean up before the next test case), so it will not affect the production code.

PKCS12 is supported by all components.

Regarding Kafka: The SSL handling is quite transparent for Flume, because it happens between the Kafka client and the broker. We just pass the SSL config params (either through Kafka parameters like 'ssl.truststore.location' or -D system properties) to the Kafka client and all other things happen within the client. So we rely on the capabilities of the Kafka client version used by Flume.

Edit:
Sorry, I forgot to answer to the Kafka vs environment variables question: When environment variables are used for setting up SSL, Flume will "convert" them to system properties (as they were passed with -D). Pls. see SSLUtil. initGlobalSSLParameters() which is invoked at startup time. From this point on all components can access the SSL config through the SSL system properties as usual.

Hi @turcsanyip @tmgstevens 
I have just did some checks. I could get some test cases to work with an SSL enabled Kafka with various configuration settings: environment vars, -D params, kafka params. All worked.

> Edit:
> Sorry, I forgot to answer to the Kafka vs environment variables question: When environment variables are used for setting up SSL, Flume will "convert" them to system properties (as they were passed with -D). Pls. see SSLUtil. initGlobalSSLParameters() which is invoked at startup time. From this point on all components can access the SSL config through the SSL system properties as usual.

Okay, that figures. I'm happy with that approach. So the only thing missing, I think, is the HTTPSource keystore type.
some documentation is in progress, I will update the PR with that and the review fixes later

The failure seems not to be caused by patch  https://builds.apache.org/job/flume-github-pull-request/org.apache.flume$flume-ng-tests/82/testReport/junit/org.apache.flume.test.agent/TestConfig/testConfigReplacement/

@ffernandez92 thanks for the contribution.

I guess this problem can be quite painful.
For performance reasons I would go another way to fix this problem. I would add a check to the close() function. It would check after successful close if the file length is 0. That is simple to implement and would happen only after a close. If the close was not called from a catch block, we could omit this for further speed.
I guess, still there could be a problem when the quota is exceeded, Flume can get into a sort of infinite loop as it tries to write the same event to HDFS again and again. Some sort off backoff should be implemented to reduce load. Needs to be checked if it is true.

Let me know please, what you think.
@szaboferee  Thanks for the changes, all looks good.

Hi!

Sorry for the late answer I’ve been a little bit under a rush lately. I think you are right @szaboferee about the performance degradation.
I think that the solution you are proposing @majorendre it was also my first approach. But it was also problematic because of what you were saying about the infinite loop when quota was reached in the middle of a write. 

I will try to reformulate the solution trying both approaches to see which one would be better.

`context.put("host", InetAddress.getLoopbackAddress().getHostAddress());`
and 
```
InetAddress localHost = InetAddress.getLocalHost();
Socket syslogSocket = new Socket(localHost, port);
```

are not the same.  `getLocalHost()` is a different IP

What should I do ? Change just my lines and break style with the rest of the file ? Just change the lines around it ? The whole file ?

There is an ongoing code quality cleanup with the current number of violations allowed for not changing the code at the same time as the quality gate was added. That is why the same violation was not breaking the build, just the new ones you added.

So I would say to just fix the new lines you have added and we will continue the cleanup later.

Thanks

我看HiveSink.java里`setupHeartBeatTimer()`的作用也仅仅是将`timeToSendHeartBeat`设置为`true`，实际触发心跳还是得等消息来时的flush。如果长时间没有消息，事务还是会自动断开。
我的处理是`HiveSink.setupHeartBeatTimer()`里直接加上`writer.heartBeat()`，不知道这样有没有问题 @hejiang2000

> 我看HiveSink.java里`setupHeartBeatTimer()`的作用也仅仅是将`timeToSendHeartBeat`设置为`true`，实际触发心跳还是得等消息来时的flush。如果长时间没有消息，事务还是会自动断开。
> 我的处理是`HiveSink.setupHeartBeatTimer()`里直接加上`writer.heartBeat()`，不知道这样有没有问题 @hejiang2000

最好不要这么做。setupHeartBeatTimer()是在异步定时通过TCP发送这个心跳信息（调用txnBatch.heartbeat()），所以有可能和我们在同一个TCP上发送数据的操作（txnBatch.commit() 等）发生冲突，导致问题。@NiXuebing

> > 我看HiveSink.java里`setupHeartBeatTimer()`的作用也仅仅是将`timeToSendHeartBeat`设置为`true`，实际触发心跳还是得等消息来时的flush。如果长时间没有消息，事务还是会自动断开。
> > 我的处理是`HiveSink.setupHeartBeatTimer()`里直接加上`writer.heartBeat()`，不知道这样有没有问题 @hejiang2000
> 
> 最好不要这么做。setupHeartBeatTimer()是在异步定时通过TCP发送这个心跳信息（调用txnBatch.heartbeat()），所以有可能和我们在同一个TCP上发送数据的操作（txnBatch.commit() 等）发生冲突，导致问题。@NiXuebing

我发现我的问题是`drainOneBatch(Channel channel)`中循环`batchSize`处理event和write的耗时太久，目前设指定`sink.batchSize`=10000，处理时间都在300秒左右，再进行`flush`时事务已经被断开了。
